content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

In Julia, you can create a function named `clean_column` as follows:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    # Lowercase the column name
    col_lower = lowercase(col)

    # Remove leading and trailing whitespaces
    col_trimmed = strip(col_lower)

    # Replace spaces and hyphens with an underscore
    col_clean = replace(col_trimmed, r"[\s-]" => "_")

    return col_clean
end
```

Now, you can use this function to clean column names accordingly:

```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"

julia> clean_column("Another-Column Name")
"another_column_name"
```
